title: Executive Order 7358-Reinstatement of Certain Former Foreign Service Officers
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by Section 12 of the Act of February 23, 1931, 46 Stat. 1207, 1208, it is ordered that Earl L. Packer and Vinton Chapin, who resigned their positions as officers in the Foreign Service of the United States on May 1, 1929, and April 15, 1932, respectively, to accept appointments to positions in the Department of State, be, and they are hereby, reinstated in the Foreign Service of the United States in the classes indicated below, their reinstatement to be effective upon the date their nominations to positions in such classes are confirmed by the Senate:
[NAME], of Utah, Foreign Service officer, Class IV.     [NAME], of Massachusetts, Foreign Service officer, Class VI.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 7358-Reinstatement of Certain Former Foreign Service Officers Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/355793
